title: (x) New York Times Sunday Magazine headlines - Cheltenham (custom version) {Carl C}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111228im_/http:/typophile.com/files/436418144_1fcc11a401_3488.jpg)

The lady in front of me on the airplane was reading this magazine that had beautiful typography, I just had to snap some pics. I'll be extra thankful if you can ID the magazine as well!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [436418144\_1fcc11a401.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111228/http:/typophile.com/files/436418144_1fcc11a401.jpg) | 84.67 KB |
author: Tyler Lang

comments.content: That is the New York Times Sunday Magazine. Somebody will be along shortly to tell you all about the types.
Is that M. Carter's custom Cheltenham? I know it's a Cheltenham.

The headline typeface is a custom Cheltenham designed by Matthew Carter:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/17826](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17826 "http://www.typophile.com/node/17826")

[http://www.nytimes.com/2003/10/21/business/media/21PAPE.html?ex=11751408...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111228/http:/www.nytimes.com/2003/10/21/business/media/21PAPE.html?ex=1175140800&en=6dc803c1345ebdd9&ei=5070 "http://www.nytimes.com/2003/10/21/business/media/21PAPE.html?ex=1175140800&en=6dc803c1345ebdd9&ei=5070")
It must be a custom version of his Cheltenham. I can't find this version anywhere.

As far as I know, it was commissioned for exclusive use by the NYT, so unfortunately you won't be able to find this exact version anywhere, unless they decide to release it to the public.

- Lex
